channel.title: John Graham | Full-Stack Developer
channel.description: Full-Stack Developer specialized in React, TypeScript, Node.js, and modern web applications. Portfolio showcasing projects and technical articles.

item.title: Rainbow Room Inventory: Crafting Management Tools for Children's Advocacy Center
item.description: I developed a full-stack inventory tracking web application for the Children's Advocacy Center's "Rainbow Room" to track donated items, manage categories and sizes, generate QR codes, handle photos, and import/export data.

item.title: Creating an Internal Merchandise Store: Simplifying Company Swag Distribution
item.description: Company merchandise is more than just branded swag—it's a tangible expression of company culture and team unity.

item.title: Developing a Job Application Tracker for The Joshua Center
item.description: When The Joshua Center approached me about building a job application tracking system, I saw an opportunity to create something that would genuinely help both the organization and the people they serve.

item.title: Escape from the Audit Labyrinth: Why I Left IT Audit Behind
item.description: Three years ago, I was sitting in a beige conference room reviewing yet another spreadsheet of control matrices when I had a realization - I was deeply, profoundly unfulfilled.

item.title: The Pay-to-Win Paradox: The Ethical Problem with Microtransactions
item.description: As someone who has been gaming since the NES era, I've witnessed the industry's evolution from simple cartridge games to today's complex digital ecosystems with troubling microtransactions.

item.title: The DoorDash Dilemma: My Delivery App Addiction
item.description: I'll admit it upfront - I've been a DoorDash addict. For nearly three years, I ordered food delivery 4-5 times weekly, watching my savings dwindle while my waistline expanded. What started as an occasional convenience during busy workweeks gradually morphed into a default behavior.

item.title: The Convergence of Creativity: Game Development as Artistic Fusion
item.description: Game development occupies a unique space in the creative landscape – it's perhaps the only medium that demands mastery across multiple creative disciplines.

item.title: Notes of Knowledge: How Being a Band Nerd Shaped My Learning Process
item.description: Growing up as a self-proclaimed "band nerd," I spent countless hours in practice rooms, rehearsals, and performances. What I didn't realize then was that those experiences were teaching me not just about music, but about the fundamental process of learning itself.

item.title: The Language Showdown: Go vs Rust for Web and Game Development
item.description: When deciding on a programming language for your next project, Go and Rust frequently emerge as modern contenders with enthusiastic communities. Having worked with both in professional settings for web and game development, I'd like to share an honest, experience-based comparison of these languages across these different domains.

item.title: Web Dev Tools I Use
item.description: As a web developer, your choice of tools can dramatically impact your productivity, code quality, and overall enjoyment of the development process. Over the years, I've experimented with countless frameworks, libraries, and tools before settling on my current tech stack.

item.title: JavaScript Journey: The Ultimate Learning Resource Guide
item.description: JavaScript has become one of the most essential languages for web development, powering everything from interactive websites to complex web applications. Here's my compilation of favorite resources.

item.title: Markdown Mastery: Beyond the Basics
item.description: After mastering the basics of Markdown, it's time to dive into some advanced techniques that will make your documentation, READMEs, and technical writing stand out.
